instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Client tried remove battery with installed logic board and he damaged <CHIP>U6550</CHIP> (it is cracked).
No sound, no audio devices in system settings.
Removed that IC and found fried pad 23 but it has still connection with path.
Still no audio and not visible audio device in settings.

Will try with new IC but waiting for delivery.

Left fan is running on max rpm all the time.
Checked temp sensors in iStat menus and all looks OK (it is linked with speaker amp.

Is there any think what I can do before new speaker amp IC will arrive?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
The speaker amps connect directly with audio codec <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>; it may be damaged now.
Check resistors between PCH and audio codec.
Also check power rails of <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
1.8V power rail going in <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.
Resistors between PCH and audio codec <RESISTOR>R6203</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR>-13 are OK.

That speaker amp which was cracked had burned out pad. That line is  <SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> and as you said it is connected directly with <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>. On that path there is <RESISTOR>R6291</RESISTOR> which on one side it has <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> and resistance should be 47K but it is only 1.6K.

Checked rest of resistors around <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and here is what is not right:
<RESISTOR>R6227</RESISTOR> should be 1.5K but it is 69Ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message: Compare diode mode to ground readings between SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message: Remove <RESISTOR>R6229</RESISTOR> and check again, over <CAPACITOR>C6288</CAPACITOR>/89 pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Then the problem comes from <CHIP>U6300</CHIP>, or <CHIP>U6500</CHIP>/50.
Remove them (one by one) and check when  <SIGNAL>AUD_I2C_1B_SCL</SIGNAL> goes high; in diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6500</CHIP> removed (<CHIP>U6550</CHIP> was cracked at the start so it was removed at the begging) and <SIGNAL>AUD_I2C_1B_SCL</SIGNAL> got 0.340V in diode mode :)
Fitted <RESISTOR>R6229</RESISTOR> back in place and audio device visible in settings and sound works on one channel :)
Waiting for delivery with speaker amp ICs.

Still left fan runs at max RPMs all the time - iStat temp sensors show all correct temps - any idea with that one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Did you try another fan?
Compare diode mode readings between <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 areas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Diode mode between <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 areas are the same and resitors around <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 areas got the same resistance.
With new fan and new keyboard flex same issue.

edit: I just swapped logic board from another one and one fan is still on max rpms so all looks like some issue with keyboard/palmrest.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Tried with good known trackpad and flex cable and same issue.
Swapped logic board to another machine and fan speed is working fine so on 99.9% keyboard/palmrest is faulty.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message: The fan controller is placed on the keyboard .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
threads.message:
Speaker amps replaced, palmrest replaced and all working fine.

Many thank for help :)
